item.title: DataSafes
item.description: The problem Personal information is simultaneously the most valuable data for addressing societal problems and the most dangerous data for individual privacy. Data can show us how to better educate our children, avoid disease, reduce crime and incarceration, improve public services, and more.

item.title: MACA
item.description: Promising new approaches to mitigate and adapt to climate change are emerging today from laboratories and startups. But on their current course, most will take too many decades to achieve the scale of adoption necessary to make a meaningful contribution to our urgent climate challenges.

item.title: Scalable Prevention of Chronic Disease
item.description: The Scalable Prevention of Chronic Disease program takes aim at one of the most expensive and rapidly growing areas of U.S. healthcare: chronic disease. Despite a degree of progress with wellness and coaching programs, fewer than one percent of the 84 million Americans at risk of diabetes are pursuing the healthy habits that are proven to prevent the disease.
